class SqList<T> {    private ArrayList<T> sqList;    public  void init() {        sqList = new ArrayList<>();    }    public void destroy() {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        sqList.clear();        sqList = null;    }    public void clear() {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        sqList.clear();    }    public boolean isEmpty() {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        return sqList.isEmpty();    }    public int len() {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        return sqList.size();    }    public T getElem(int index) {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        return sqList.get(index);    }    public T priorElem(T t) {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        int position = sqList.indexOf(t);        if(position <= 1) {            return null;        } else {            return sqList.get(position - 1);        }    }    public T nextElem(T t) {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        int position = sqList.indexOf(t);        if(position == sqList.size() - 1) {            return null;        } else {            return sqList.get(position + 1);        }    }    public void insElem(T t) {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        sqList.add(t);    }    public T delElem(int index) {        if(sqList == null)            throw new NullPointerException();        return sqList.remove(index);    }    public void print() {        if(sqList == null)            System.out.println("çº¿æ€§è¡¨å·²ç»é”€æ¯ï¼");        else            System.out.println(Arrays.toString( sqList.toArray()));;    }}

Status ListInsert_Dul(Dulink &L,int i,ElemType e) {    if(!(p = GetElem(L,i))) return ERROR;    s = new DuLnode;    s->data = e;    s->prior = p->prior;    s->next = p;    p->prior->next = s;    p->prior = s;    return OK;}

Status ListDelete_Dul(Dulink &L,int i) {    if(!(p = GetElem(L,i))) return ERROR;    p->next->prior = p->prior;    p->prior->next = p->next;    return OK;}

# create tb_fruitsCREATE TABLE fruits(    f_id    char(10)     NOT NULL,    s_id    INT        NOT NULL,    f_name  char(255)  NOT NULL,    f_price decimal(8,2)  NOT NULL,    PRIMARY KEY(f_id) );# insert data into tb_fruitsINSERT INTO fruits (f_id, s_id, f_name, f_price)VALUES('a1',101,'apple',5.2),('b1',101,'blackberry', 10.2),('bs1',102,'orange', 11.2),('bs2',105,'melon',8.2),('t1',102,'banana', 10.3),('t2',102,'grape', 5.3),('o2',103,'coconut', 9.2),('c0',101,'cherry', 3.2),('a2',103, 'apricot',2.2),('l2',104,'lemon', 6.4),('b2',104,'berry', 7.6),('m1',106,'mango', 15.6),('m2',105,'xbabay', 2.6),('t4',107,'xbababa', 3.6),('m3',105,'xxtt', 11.6),('b5',107,'xxxx', 3.6);

â€œæ³¨â€ ï¼šè¿™é‡Œé€šè¿‡ä¸€ä¸ªèšé›†å‡½æ•°COUNTè®¡ç®—å‡ºæ¯ä¸ªåˆ†ç»„å«æœ‰çš„æ•°ç›®

å½“ç„¶æˆ‘ä»¬è¿˜å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªç‰¹æ®Šçš„å‡½æ•°GROUP_CONCATå°†æ¯ä¸ªåˆ†ç»„çš„æ°´æœåç§°æ˜¾ç¤ºå‡ºæ¥ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”é€šè¿‡HAVINGå­å¥å¯¹åˆ†ç»„è¿›è¡Œè¿‡æ»¤ï¼Œæ’é™¤åˆ†ç»„æ•°ç›®ä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªçš„ç»„çš„æ°´æœåç§°ï¼

æ ¹æ®s_idå¯¹fruitsè¡¨ä¸­çš„æ•°æ®è¿›è¡Œåˆ†ç»„ï¼Œå¹¶æ˜¾ç¤ºæ°´æœç§ç±»å¤§äº1çš„åˆ†ç»„ä¿¡æ¯

mysql> SELECT s_id, GROUP_CONCAT(f_name) AS Names    -> FROM fruits    -> GROUP BY s_id    -> HAVING COUNT(f_name) > 1;+------+-------------------------+| s_id | Names                   |+------+-------------------------+|  101 | apple,blackberry,cherry ||  102 | orange,banana,grape     ||  103 | apricot,coconut         ||  104 | berry,lemon             ||  105 | melon,xbabay,xxtt       ||  107 | xxxx,xbababa            |+------+-------------------------+

åœ¨MySQLä¸­è¿˜æä¾›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªå…³é”®æ“ä½œWITH ROLLUPç»Ÿè®¡è®°å½•çš„æ•°é‡ã€‚ï¼ˆORDER BYä¸WITH ROLLUPå…·æœ‰ä¸å…¼å®¹æ€§ï¼‰

public interface List<E> {    default void replaceAll(UnaryOperator<E> operator) {        Objects.requireNonNull(operator);        final ListIterator<E> li = this.listIterator();        while (li.hasNext()) {            li.set(operator.apply(li.next()));        }    }        @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked", "rawtypes"})    default void sort(Comparator<? super E> c) {        Object[] a = this.toArray();        Arrays.sort(a, (Comparator) c);        ListIterator<E> i = this.listIterator();        for (Object e : a) {            i.next();            i.set((E) e);        }    }        @Override    default Spliterator<E> spliterator() {        return Spliterators.spliterator(this, Spliterator.ORDERED);    }}

private void checkElementIndex(int index) {    if (!isElementIndex(index))        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(outOfBoundsMsg(index));}    private boolean isElementIndex(int index) {        return index >= 0 && index < size;    }Node<E> node(int index) {    // assert isElementIndex(index);  ä¸ºäº†ä¿è¯ç´¢å¼•çš„æ­£ç¡®æ€§    // äºŒåˆ†æŸ¥æ‰¾ï¼Œåˆ¤æ–­ç´¢å¼•å±äºå‰åŠæ®µè¿˜æ˜¯ååŠæ®µï¼Œç„¶åé‡‡å–é“¾è¡¨çš„é¡ºåºéå†å¾—åˆ°å¯¹åº”ä½ç½®çš„å…ƒç´     if (index < (size >> 1)) {        Node<E> x = first;        for (int i = 0; i < index; i++)            x = x.next;        return x;    } else {        Node<E> x = last;        for (int i = size - 1; i > index; i--)            x = x.prev;        return x;    }}

void linkBefore(E e, Node<E> succ) {    // assert succ != null;    final Node<E> pred = succ.prev;    final Node<E> newNode = new Node<>(pred, e, succ);    succ.prev = newNode;    if (pred == null)        first = newNode;    else        pred.next = newNode;    size++;    modCount++;}

public int indexOf(Object o) {    int index = 0;    if (o == null) {        for (Node<E> x = first; x != null; x = x.next) {            if (x.item == null)                return index;            index++;        }    } else {        for (Node<E> x = first; x != null; x = x.next) {            if (o.equals(x.item))                return index;            index++;        }    }    return -1;}

public boolean addAll(int index, Collection<? extends E> c) {    checkPositionIndex(index);    Object[] a = c.toArray();    int numNew = a.length;    if (numNew == 0)        return false;    Node<E> pred, succ;    if (index == size) {        succ = null;        pred = last;    } else {        succ = node(index);        pred = succ.prev;    }    for (Object o : a) {        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") E e = (E) o;        Node<E> newNode = new Node<>(pred, e, null);        if (pred == null)            first = newNode;        else            pred.next = newNode;        pred = newNode;    }    if (succ == null) {        last = pred;    } else {        pred.next = succ;        succ.prev = pred;    }    size += numNew;    modCount++;    return true;}

private class ListItr implements ListIterator<E> {    private Node<E> lastReturned;           // ä¸Šæ¬¡è¿”å›çš„ç»“ç‚¹    private Node<E> next;                   // ä¸‹ä¸€æ¬¡å°†è¿­ä»£è®¿é—®çš„ç»“ç‚¹    private int nextIndex;                  // ä¸‹ä¸€æ¬¡å°†è¿­ä»£è®¿é—®çš„ç»“ç‚¹çš„ä½ç½®    private int expectedModCount = modCount;// é›†åˆä¿®æ”¹æ¬¡æ•°    // æ„é€ èµ·å§‹ä½ç½®ä¸ºindexçš„è¿­ä»£å™¨æŒ‡é’ˆå¼•ç”¨    ListItr(int index) {        // assert isPositionIndex(index);        next = (index == size) ? null : node(index);        nextIndex = index;    }    public boolean hasNext() {        return nextIndex < size;    }    // nextæ–¹æ³•çš„ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ æ˜¯è¿­ä»£å™¨èµ·ç‚¹å…ƒç´  æ¯”å¦‚listIterator(3) : å°±æ˜¯link[3]    public E next() {        checkForComodification();        if (!hasNext())            throw new NoSuchElementException();        // ä¿ç•™è·¨è¶Šå…ƒç´ ï¼Œå†è·¨è¶Šå…ƒç´         lastReturned = next;        next = next.next;        nextIndex++;        return lastReturned.item;    }    public boolean hasPrevious() {        return nextIndex > 0;    }    // previousçš„ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ æ˜¯è¿­ä»£å™¨èµ·ç‚¹å…ƒç´ çš„å‰ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´  æ¯”å¦‚listIterator(3) : å°±æ˜¯link[2]    public E previous() {        checkForComodification();        if (!hasPrevious())            throw new NoSuchElementException();        lastReturned = next = (next == null) ? last : next.prev;        nextIndex--;        return lastReturned.item;    }    public int nextIndex() {        return nextIndex;    }    public int previousIndex() {        return nextIndex - 1;    }    public void remove() {        checkForComodification();        if (lastReturned == null)            throw new IllegalStateException();        Node<E> lastNext = lastReturned.next;        unlink(lastReturned);        if (next == lastReturned)            next = lastNext;        else            nextIndex--;        lastReturned = null;        expectedModCount++;    }    public void set(E e) {        if (lastReturned == null)            throw new IllegalStateException();        checkForComodification();        lastReturned.item = e;    }    public void add(E e) {        checkForComodification();        lastReturned = null;        if (next == null)            linkLast(e);        else            linkBefore(e, next);        nextIndex++;        expectedModCount++;    }    public void forEachRemaining(Consumer<? super E> action) {        Objects.requireNonNull(action);        while (modCount == expectedModCount && nextIndex < size) {            action.accept(next.item);            lastReturned = next;            next = next.next;            nextIndex++;        }        checkForComodification();    }    final void checkForComodification() {        if (modCount != expectedModCount)            throw new ConcurrentModificationException();    }}

public class LengthComparatorTest {    public static void main(String[] args) {        String[] strings = {"i","am","second","your","you"};        Arrays.sort(strings,new LengthComparator());        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(strings));    }}class LengthComparator implements Comparator<String> {    @Override    public int compare(String first,String second) {        return first.length() - second.length();    }}

public ArrayList(int initialCapacity) {    // if...else if...elseç»“æ„å®Œæˆä¸‰ç§æƒ…å†µçš„è®¨è®º    if (initialCapacity > 0) {        this.elementData = new Object[initialCapacity];    } else if (initialCapacity == 0) {        this.elementData = EMPTY_ELEMENTDATA;    } else {        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Illegal Capacity: "+ initialCapacity);    }}

(3) public ArrayList(Collection<? extends E> c)æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•å®ç°åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªåŒ…å«collectionå…ƒç´ çš„åˆ—è¡¨ï¼ŒæŒ‰ç…§collectionçš„è¿­ä»£å™¨è¿”å›çš„é¡ºåºæ¥æ’åˆ—ï¼Ÿ

public ArrayList(Collection<? extends E> c) {    // é›†åˆå…ƒç´ è½¬æˆæ•°ç»„    Object[] a = c.toArray();        //ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡åˆ¤æ–­æ•°ç»„æ˜¯å¦ä¸ºç©ºã€å¹¶å®Œæˆé€»è¾‘é•¿åº¦çš„èµ‹å€¼    if ((size = a.length) != 0) {        // ç¬¬äºŒæ¬¡ç±»å‹åˆ¤æ–­ã€å®Œæˆæ•°ç»„çš„æ‹·è´        if (c.getClass() == ArrayList.class) {            elementData = a;        } else {            elementData = Arrays.copyOf(a, size, Object[].class);        }    } else {        elementData = EMPTY_ELEMENTDATA;    }}

private void ensureCapacityInternal(int minCapacity) {    ensureExplicitCapacity(calculateCapacity(elementData, minCapacity));}private static int calculateCapacity(Object[] elementData, int minCapacity) {    if (elementData == DEFAULTCAPACITY_EMPTY_ELEMENTDATA) {        return Math.max(DEFAULT_CAPACITY, minCapacity);    }    return minCapacity;}private void ensureExplicitCapacity(int minCapacity) {    modCount++;    // overflow-conscious code    if (minCapacity - elementData.length > 0)        grow(minCapacity);}private static final int MAX_ARRAY_SIZE = Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8;private void grow(int minCapacity) {    // overflow-conscious code    int oldCapacity = elementData.length;    int newCapacity = oldCapacity + (oldCapacity >> 1);    if (newCapacity - minCapacity < 0)        newCapacity = minCapacity;    if (newCapacity - MAX_ARRAY_SIZE > 0)        newCapacity = hugeCapacity(minCapacity);    // minCapacity is usually close to size, so this is a win:    elementData = Arrays.copyOf(elementData, newCapacity);}private static int hugeCapacity(int minCapacity) {    if (minCapacity < 0) // overflow        throw new OutOfMemoryError();    return (minCapacity > MAX_ARRAY_SIZE) ?        Integer.MAX_VALUE :    MAX_ARRAY_SIZE;}

public boolean add(E e)æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•å®ç°åŠ å…¥ä¸€ä¸ªeï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”è¿”å›æˆåŠŸæ ‡å¿—ï¼Œä»¥åŠå¯¹æ•°ç»„çš„åŠ¨æ€è°ƒæ•´ï¼Ÿ

/** addæºç åˆ†æ * @author MateMaster * @version JDK-8U281 */public boolean add(E e) {    ensureCapacityInternal(size + 1);  // Increments modCount!!    elementData[size++] = e;    return true;}

public void add(int index, E element)æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•å®ç°åœ¨æŒ‡å®šä½ç½®indexåŠ å…¥å…ƒç´ eï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”å®Œæˆå¯¹æ•°ç»„çš„åŠ¨æ€è°ƒæ•´ï¼Ÿ

public void add(int index, E element) {    rangeCheckForAdd(index);        ensureCapacityInternal(size + 1);    //System.arraycopy : å®Œæˆæ’å…¥å‰ï¼Œæ’å…¥ä½ç½®æ•°ç»„å…ƒç´ åœ°å³ç§»    System.arraycopy(elementData, index, elementData, index+1, size-index);    elementData[index] = element;    size++;}private void rangeCheckForAdd(int index) {    if(index > size || index < 0)        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(outOfBoundsMsg(index));}private String outOfBoundsMsg(int index) {    return "Index:" +index+ ",Size:" +size;}//å…³äº ensureCapacityInternal()ç³»åˆ—çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå¯ä»¥å‚è€ƒä¸Šé¢çš„addæ–¹æ³•
addAllå«ä¹‰
public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c)å°†é›†åˆcollectionå…ƒç´ åŠ å…¥åˆ°åˆ—è¡¨ä¸­
public boolean addAll(int index, Collection<? extends E> c)åœ¨æŒ‡å®šçš„ä½ç½®åŠ å…¥é›†åˆå…ƒç´ 
public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c) {    //ç”ŸæˆåŒ…å«é›†åˆå…ƒç´ çš„æ•°ç»„ã€å¹¶å°†é€»è¾‘é•¿åº¦å¤åˆ¶ä¸ºnumNew    Object[] a = c.toArray();    int numNew = a.length;    //ensureCapacityInternal : ç¡®ä¿æ•°ç»„çš„å®¹é‡    ensureCapacityInternal(size + numNew);    //System.arraycopy : å°†é›†åˆcé‡Œçš„å…ƒç´ å¤åˆ¶åˆ°åˆ—è¡¨é‡Œé¢    System.arraycopy(a, 0 , elementData, size, numNew);    size += numNew;    return (numNew != 0);}
public boolean addAll(int index, Collection<? extends E> c) {    rangeCheckForAdd(index);    Object[] a = c.toArray();    int numNew = a.length;    ensureCapacityInternal(size + numNew);        int numMoved = size - index;    if(numMoved > 0) {        //System.arraycopy : å®Œæˆå¯¹æ•°ç»„å…ƒç´ çš„ç§»åŠ¨        System.arraycopy(elementData, index, elementData, index+numNew, numMoved);    }    //System.arraycopy : å°†é›†åˆcå…ƒç´ å¤åˆ¶åˆ°ç›¸åº”çš„ä½ç½®    System.arraycopy(a, 0, elementData, index, numNew);    size += numNew;    return (numNew != 0);}

æ€»ç»“ï¼š ä»ä¸Šè¿°çš„ä»£ç æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡ºï¼Œå…³äºå…ƒç´ çš„æ·»åŠ çš„æ ¸å¿ƒå†…å®¹ä¸»è¦åœ¨äºï¼š1.æ•°ç»„å®¹é‡çš„æ­£ç¡®è°ƒæ•´ã€‚2.æ•°ç»„å…ƒç´ çš„æ­£ç¡®å¤åˆ¶ã€‚ä¹Ÿå°±æ˜¯ä»¥ensureCapacityInternal()ç³»åˆ—æ–¹æ³•ä¸ºæ ¸å¿ƒçš„å®¹é‡çš„åŠ¨æ€è°ƒæ•´ï¼Œä»¥åŠSystem.arraycopy()æ–¹æ³•çš„ä¸¤ç§ä½œç”¨â€”â€”å…ƒç´ ç§»åŠ¨ã€å…ƒç´ å¤åˆ¶ã€‚

public E remove(int index) {    // é¦–å…ˆåˆ¤æ–­ç´¢å¼•ä½ç½®æ˜¯å¦åˆç†    rangeCheck(index);        modCount++;    // å…¶æ¬¡ä¿ç•™åˆ é™¤å†…å®¹    E oldValue = elementData(index);        // ç¡®å®šéœ€è¦ç§»åŠ¨å…ƒç´ çš„ä¸ªæ•°    int numMoved = size - index - 1;    // åˆ¤æ–­ä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”å®Œæˆç§»åŠ¨    if(numMoved > 0) {        System.arraycopy(elementData, index+1, elementData, index, numMoved);    }    //ç§»åŠ¨ç»“æŸåï¼Œåˆ—è¡¨å°¾éƒ¨ç½®ç©ºï¼Œå®Œæˆåˆ é™¤æ“ä½œ    elementData[--size] = null;        return oldValue;}//check indexprivate void rangeCheck(int index) {    if(index >= size) {        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(outOfBoundsMsg(index));    }}private String outOfBoundMsg(int index) {    return ("Index:" + index+ ", Size:" + size);}//positional accessprivate E elementData(int index) {    return (E) elementData[index];}

public boolean remove(Object o) {    if(o == null) {        for(int i=0; i<size; i++) {            if(elementData[i] == null){                fastRemove(i);                return true;            }        }    } else {        for(int i=0; i<size; i++) {            if(o.equals(elementData[i])) {                fastRemove(i);                return true;            }        }    }        return false;}// fastRemoveprivate void fastRemove(int index) {    modCount++;    int numMoved = size - index -1;    if(numMoved > 0) {        System.arraycopy(elementData, index+1, elementData, index, numMoved);    }    elementData[--size] = null;}

public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {    // åˆ¤æ–­å¯¹è±¡æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯ç©º    Objects.requireNonNull(c);    // æ‰¹åˆ é™¤æ“ä½œ    return batchRemove(c,false);}
public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {    Objects.requireNonNull(c);    return batchRemove(c,true);}

private boolean batchRemove(Collection<?> c, boolean complement) {    final Object[] copyData = elementData;    int read =0, write = 0;    boolean modified = false;    try {        for(; read < size; read++) {            if(c.contains(copyData[read]) == complement)                elementData[write++] = copyData[read];        }    } finally {        if (read != size) {            System.arraycopy(copyData, read, elementData, write, size - read);            write += size - read;        }        if (write != size) {            // clear to let GC do its work            for (int i = write; i < size; i++)                copyData[i] = null;            modCount += size - write;            size = write;            modified = true;        }     }    return modified;}

protected void removeRange(int fromIndex, int toIndex) {    modCount++;    // ç¡®å®šç§»åŠ¨ä¸ªæ•°ï¼Œå¹¶ç§»åŠ¨    int numMoved = size - toIndex;    System.arraycopy(elementData, toIndex, elementData, fromIndex, numMoved);        // ç¡®å®šæ–°çš„sizeã€å¹¶ä¸”å°† [size - (toIndex - fromIndex),size)çš„å…ƒç´ æ¸…ç©º    int newSize = size - (toIndex - fromIndex);    for(int i=newSize; i<size; i++) {        elementData[i] = null;    }    // é‡æ–°è®¾ç½®size    size = newSize;}

public String toString()å°†åˆ—è¡¨ä»¥æ•°ç»„çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸²å½¢å¼è¾“å‡ºï¼ˆç»§æ‰¿è‡ªAbstractCollectionï¼‰
public abstract class AbstractCollection<E> implements Collection<E> {        public String toString() {        // è·å–è¿­ä»£å™¨        Iterator<E> it = iterator();                // åˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯å¦æœ‰å…ƒç´         if(! it.hasNext()) {            return ("[]");        }                // æ”¶é›†å…ƒç´ è½¬æ¢æˆå­—ç¬¦ä¸²        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();        sb.append("[");        while(true) {            E e = it.next();            sb.append(e == this ? "(this collection)" : e);            if(! it.hasNext()) {                return sb.append("]").toString;            }            sb.append(',').append(' ');        }        }}

public Iterator<E> iterator()
public class ArrayList<E> {        public Iterator<E> iterator() {        return new Itr();    }        private class Itr implements Iterator<E> {        int cursor;        int lastRet = -1;        int exceptedModCount = modCount;                Itr() {}                public boolean hasNext() {            return (cursor !=size);        }                public E next() {            checkForComodification();                        int current = cursor;            if(current >= size) {                throw new NoSuchElementException();            }            Object[] data = ArrayList.this.elementData;            if(current >= data.length) {                 throw new ConcurrentModificationException();            }                        cursor = current + 1;            return (E) data[lastRet = current];        }                        final void checkForComodification() {            if (modCount != expectedModCount)                throw new ConcurrentModificationException();        }    }}

private void ensureCapacityInternal(int minCapacity) {    ensureExplicitCapacity(calculateCapacity(elementData, minCapacity));}private static int calculateCapacity(Object[] elementData, int minCapacity) {    if (elementData == DEFAULTCAPACITY_EMPTY_ELEMENTDATA) {        return Math.max(DEFAULT_CAPACITY, minCapacity);    }    return minCapacity;}private void ensureExplicitCapacity(int minCapacity) {    modCount++;    // overflow-conscious code    if (minCapacity - elementData.length > 0)        grow(minCapacity);}private static final int MAX_ARRAY_SIZE = Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8;private void grow(int minCapacity) {    // overflow-conscious code    int oldCapacity = elementData.length;    int newCapacity = oldCapacity + (oldCapacity >> 1);    if (newCapacity - minCapacity < 0)        newCapacity = minCapacity;    if (newCapacity - MAX_ARRAY_SIZE > 0)        newCapacity = hugeCapacity(minCapacity);    // minCapacity is usually close to size, so this is a win:    elementData = Arrays.copyOf(elementData, newCapacity);}private static int hugeCapacity(int minCapacity) {    if (minCapacity < 0) // overflow        throw new OutOfMemoryError();    return (minCapacity > MAX_ARRAY_SIZE) ?        Integer.MAX_VALUE :    MAX_ARRAY_SIZE;}
